title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire Monday 8 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: hundreds of bags of rubbish dumped in newark could take another year to be removed .
a cyclist injured in a hit-and-run says he has been 'overwhelmed ' by the global response after his video footage went viral .
forest continue their unbeaten run with a 1-0 win over leeds .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for nottinghamshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : rain will ease off eventually
text: the showers will continue into this evening along with some gusty winds .
but the rain will eventually clear away and the winds will ease off a touch overnight .
the skies will be clear too by the end of the night .
it 's going to be a colder night with a minimum of 1c ( 34f ) .
author: Kaye Forster
Weather Presenter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: concerns were raised about amber peat a year before her death
text: it 's been revealed concerns were raised about the well-being of 13-year-old amber peat , more than a year before she died .
the mansfield teenager was found dead just a mile from her home after she went missing in may last year .
you can find out more about this on tonight 's inside out .
author: Simon Hare
BBC Inside Out East Midlands

documents.title: when a club legend joins your fiercest rivals
text: forest legend des walker has joined derby county 's coaching set-up .
the 50-year-old played 408 matches for forest during two spells , totalling nearly 12 years .
his son tyler , 19 , is currently a striker for the reds while his 17-year-old son lewis recently signed with the rams from ilkeston .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: leak was 'emergency situation ' and decision was regrettable
text: the owners of cop lodge , ideal care homes , say they had to close the entire right side of the building because of serious problems with sewage , and that happened to be where all the dementia residents were .
all 22 of them have now found new accommodation but their relatives have still not been happy about it .
samanatha barclay , regional director for ideal care homes , said it had been a `` regrettable decision '' but she described it as an `` emergency situation beyond their control ''

documents.title: your photos : water levels high at attenborough
text: these ducks might be the only ones who are enjoying all the rain we 've been having , as water levels rose at attenborough nature reserve today .
this photo was posted by our weather watcher meg .

documents.title: dementia residents moved from home after leak
text: all 22 dementia patients from cop lodge care home in arnold have been moved out - with just 48 hours notice .
they were moved after a sewage leak was found under the building .
the families of residents there have been telling us they 're unhappy they were given so little notice .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: your final headlines for today :
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: ex forest and notts defenders join derby
text: er not sure how to break this to you all but former forest defender des walker and notts defender and manager craig short have joined derby county 's academy coaching staff .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: travel : delays expected on london road
text: temporary signals at london road / meadow lane junction are going to cause delays and tailbacks on all approaches throughout peak traffic

documents.title: 'community rid of individuals ' say police
text: a second nottinghamshire man to be jailed for his part in the huge drug operation in grantham is tyrone sly .
the 46-year-old from bye path road , retford , previously admitted his involvement and was sentenced to 10 years and six months .

after sentencing , ch insp mark kirwa , of lincolnshire police , said : `` the community will be rid of these individuals for a significant amount of time and the scourge that they brought with them . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: chefs break new pancake tower record
text: a group of nottingham chefs have claimed to set a new record for the tallest ever stack of pancakes this morning .
author: Mansfield Chad

documents.title: 'we have a safeguarding duty ' says council boss
text: the head of adult social care at the city council said most homes in nottingham provided a good service , but whenever relatives had concerns they should report it .
helen jones said with autumn grange , relatives had complained to the home about conditions there , but did n't know they cold complain to social services too .
`` we have a safeguarding duty for people , '' she said .
`` and we need to make sure they are not at risk at home . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man jailed for part in illegal sale of drugs
text: a nottinghamshire man has been jailed along with a gang who `` flooded '' grantham with illgeal drugs such as heroin and cocaine
james straw , 50 , of petersmith drive , ollerton was jailed for 16 years after he was found guilty last year of selling drugs `` on a huge scale '' in the lincolnshire town .
the court heard the charges related to a period between january and october 2014 when `` massive '' amounts of drugs were brought into the town and sold for huge profits .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : delays expected on london road until tomorrow
text: there are still delays on london road heading into the city centre because of an earlier accident .
traffic lights are out as a result and temporary signals will remain until tomorrow so delays are expected .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: care home death 'was a shock ' say family
text: nottingham city council says it stepped in at autumn grange after concerns were raised but ms atkin died days after she was removed from the home .
the home was eventually closed after the city council suspended its contract .
ms atkin 's family say what happened to her was `` a huge shock '' .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: free childcare for parents of toddlers
text: nottinghamshire county council is one of 25 local authorities that has been chosen to to take part in a pilot scheme offering parents of three and four-year-olds 30 hours free childcare from september .
author: Hucknall Dispatch

documents.title: council urges relatives to report care home concerns
text: relatives are being urged to report any serious concerns they have about care homes to social services , after an owner was jailed for manslaughter on friday .
yousaf khan admitted causing the death of ivy atkin at autumn grange in nottingham .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: festival renames stage after metal frontman
text: download has renamed its main stage after motorhead frontman lemmy who died from cancer in december .
the band had been due to play on the friday night of the rock festival at donington park in june .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: your views : 'lights missing ' at event
text: you 've been giving your thoughts on the council 's light night event on friday .
on facebook , richard lawson wrote : `` wife and son went down and they both said it was a poor effort , particularly nottingham castle .
chris page was n't too impressed either : `` all it was missing was lights . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: cyclist received messages from around world
text: the cyclist , whose video of him being involved in a hit-and-run crash went viral , said he received thousands of messages from around the world .
going by the name of reginald scot , he said : `` the response has been massive and i 've had literally thousands of messages from america , australia , asia and europe .
`` i think everyone was surprised at the ferocity of the attack against a cyclist on the road . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: teenager missing from wollaton
text: rebecca smith , aged 16 has been missing since yesterday afternoon .
police said she was last seen in wollaton .

documents.title: head teacher praises pupils for 'mature response ' to bomb hoax
text: the headteacher of nottingham high school in waverley mount , forest fields , said although they felt the threat they received this morning was a hoax they immediately reported it to police .

in a statement , kevin fear said students had been `` magnificent in their mature response '' and added : `` we will remain vigilant and will always place the safety of our staff and pupils as our main consideration . ''
author: Lisa Teanby
Newsreader, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: weather : showers carry on with strong winds
text: showers continue through the afternoon with strong winds and gusts of up to 50mph .
highs of 8c ( 46f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: win for nottingham badminton star
text: nottingham badminton stars chris .
and gabby adcock are national mixed-doubles champions again .
it 's the fourth national title for the husband-and-wife pair - and their third in a row , as they beat chris coles and sophie brown 21-11 , 21-11 in the final .
tonight , the couple will line up against each other in the national badminton league , as chris plays for university of nottingham , and gabby for the surrey smashers .
author: Colin Fray
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: travel : obstruction on london road
text: rtc junction london rd/truman 's st - vehicle in middle of road - proceed with caution .

documents.title: hit-and-run cyclist 'overwhelmed ' by support
text: a cyclist who released a video of him being knocked off his bike in a hit-and-run attack says he plans to sue the insurance company of the car involved .
the video by reginald scot has now been viewed millions of times and he says he has been `` overwhelmed '' by the support he has received .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: school evacuated after hoax bomb scare
text: nottingham high school was evacuated for two hours this morning after a hoax bomb scare .
pupils and staff were allowed back in at about 10:00 after police carried out a full search of buildings and grounds .
a similar incident on thursday led to the evacuation of nottingham high school for girls and part of the tram network was suspended for a short time .
author: Klara Lethbridge
Newsreader, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: food waste has n't been ruled out at site
text: here 's what the rubbish in newark looks like from the back of the site .
a spokesman from the environment agency told us they have estimated there are 1,800 tonnes of mixed waste from commercial properties .
they do n't think there is any food waste there but that possibility has n't been ruled out .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: five-year-old boy returns to class as a girl
text: a five-year-old boy has gone back to the classroom as a girl - in what is thought to be one of the first child gender transitioning cases in nottingham .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: light night illuminates city
text: did anyone venture into nottingham city centre on friday for the light night event ?
i had a wander round in lace market and the castle and took a few of my own photos .
it 's definitely the busiest i have seen nottingham on a friday night for a while but the event has had mixed reviews .
let me know what you thought if you were there .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: ling wants to put children first
text: david ling has n't gone into too much detail about why he is leaving but says he needs to put his children first .
this was his second spell with the nottingham panthers so we 've put together a few photos from his time with the team .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: rubbish is an 'eyesore ' say residents
text: residents living near bowbridge road , newark want the tonnes of rubbish gone .
vera ellis told bbc east midlands today : `` it should be removed a lot sooner .
it could be a fire hazard as it 's next to a petrol station . ''
another man said : `` it is just an eyesore and it takes away the value of the property . ''
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: david ling announces departure after win
text: nottingham panthers forward david ling scored two goals in last night 's 6-3 win in dundee , and then announced that he was leaving the club .
ling says he 's made the decision reluctantly , and for family reasons - saying that he needs to return to his children in the us .
last night 's win left the panthers 3rd in the elite league table - evan mosey , matthew myers , andy bombach and brad moran were the other goalscorers .
author: Colin Fray
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: environment agency looking at legal action
text: the environment agency says they are looking at taking legal action against the site owner as the cost of moving the rubbish could run into six figures .
but going through the courts could mean the rubbish is n't moved for another year .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: city parks to get revamp
text: seven nottingham parks are to be revamped with new play areas , skate ramps and football pitches in a £ 600,000 investment from the city council .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: hodge sends praise to reds for unbeaten run
text: former nottingham forest and england midfielder steve hodge says the reds should be proud of their recent defensive record .
the 1-0 win at leeds at the weekend saw them stretch their run - without conceding a championship goal - to 427 minutes .
hodge says : the back four have made no bad errors .
the goalkeeper , when needed , has been brilliant , and in front of the defence , david vaughan has been the stand-out player of the last four games . ''
author: Colin Fray
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: the top stories this morning :
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: warnings of strong winds again today
text: is anyone else thinking we 've had more storms since we started naming them ?
last week we had storm henry and today we are going to feel the effects of storm imogen .
you can keep up to date with all the weather warnings across the country here .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: rubbish heap remains almost a year on
text: these bags of rubbish have been an eyesore in newark for almost a year and they still have n't been moved .
the hundreds of bags of mixed waste were dumped at a site on bowbridge road last march and despite an enforcement notice from the environment agency to the site 's owner , they 're still there .
now residents , who have complained about the smell , .
are worried about infestation problems .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : traffic lights out near trent bridge
text: a traffic signal at the junction of meadow lane and london rd has been knocked over blocking the pedestrian crossing - proceed with caution

documents.title: weather : storm imogen battering region
text: showers will be on and off through much of the daytime with some heavier downpours possible at times .
it 's a windy day too where gusts could reach up to 50mph .
highs of 7c ( 45f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : city centre traffic building
text: there 's heavy traffic on castle boulevard in nottingham this morning .
it 's around the roadworks area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: join us for today 's updates
text: hope you all had a good weekend but it 's back to business for monday and i 'm back in the hot seat .
if you want to get in touch with us about any of the stories we discuss today , you can email or tweet us .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online
